intro: Cinnagrostis macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stemmed goldenrod, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of golden-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet environments such as marshes and wet meadows. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture. Cinnagrostis macrostachya plays an important role in supporting pollinators, particularly bees and butterflies, during the late summer and early fall.
